arm_group.description: Healing Touch performed one hour prior to bed.
Healing Touch Sham provided one hour prior to bed.
Control, Presence Intervention in the room one hour prior to bed.
No Presence in the room one hour prior to bed.

brief_summary.textblock:
Healing Touch improves measures of sleep the night prior to surgery, thus improving
      surgery-related morbidity.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Healing Touch on Sleep

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. 5-22 years of age, inclusive

          2. Elective admission for a reconstructive operative procedure

          3. Planned use of general anesthesia during the elective operative procedure

          4. Written informed consent, assent and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability
             Act (HIPAA) release signed by parent or legal guardian

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. History of anoxic or suspected brain injury

          2. History of head injury within the last year

          3. Pre-existing neurological disorder

          4. History of Reynaud's syndrome

          5. Intellectual disability or inability to follow directions

          6. Face/head phenomena that prevent(s) proper placement of polysomnography(PSG) leads

          7. Taking medication for diagnosis of cardiomyopathy

clinical_study.official_title: Quantitative Analysis of Clinical, Spectral and Imaging Measures Associated With Bioenergy Sleep Therapy

primary_outcome.description: Data from nocturnal polysomnography (sleep latency, time in sleep stages, sleep efficiency, total sleep time, etc) will be compared between the healing touch and non healing touch groups.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Plan to measure the following and compare among groups:
Anesthesia Emergence Score, Vitals, Anxiety Score, Pain score
secondary_outcome.measure: Improved sleep will improve surgery-related morbidity

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
